entry.title: Taliban Commander Who Launched Bombings in Kabul Is Now a Police Chief in Charge of Security
entry.content: Mawlawi ZubairÂ Mutmaeen is one of thousands of former fighters thrown into mundane jobs as new government struggles to stay on its feet.

entry.title: Chinese Military's Flexing Stokes New Uncertainty in Taiwan
entry.content: Residents of the self-ruled island are used to living in the shadow of an authoritarian regime, but rising tensions with China are stoking uncertainty for some.

entry.title: Xi Faces Pushback on China's Bid to Tax Property
entry.content: Chinese President Xi Jinping is facing strong resistance over a nationwide property-tax plan meant to help curb housing speculation, and he is now settling for a more limited rollout, people familiar with the matter said.
